00104 /* can return NULL when the size is not big enough */
00105 char *BLI_current_working_dir(char *dir, const int maxncpy)
00106 {
00107     const char *pwd= getenv("PWD");
00108     if (pwd) {
00109         BLI_strncpy(dir, pwd, maxncpy);
00110         return dir;
00111     }
00112 
00113     return getcwd(dir, maxncpy);
00114 }

00117 static int bli_compare(struct direntry *entry1, struct direntry *entry2)
00118 {
00119     /* type is equal to stat.st_mode */
00120 
00121     if (S_ISDIR(entry1->type)) {
00122         if (S_ISDIR(entry2->type)==0) return (-1);
00123     }
00124     else {
00125         if (S_ISDIR(entry2->type)) return (1);
00126     }
00127     if (S_ISREG(entry1->type)) {
00128         if (S_ISREG(entry2->type)==0) return (-1);
00129     }
00130     else {
00131         if (S_ISREG(entry2->type)) return (1);
00132     }
00133     if ((entry1->type & S_IFMT) < (entry2->type & S_IFMT)) return (-1);
00134     if ((entry1->type & S_IFMT) > (entry2->type & S_IFMT)) return (1);
00135     
00136     /* make sure "." and ".." are always first */
00137     if ( strcmp(entry1->relname, ".")==0 ) return (-1);
00138     if ( strcmp(entry2->relname, ".")==0 ) return (1);
00139     if ( strcmp(entry1->relname, "..")==0 ) return (-1);
00140     if ( strcmp(entry2->relname, "..")==0 ) return (1);
00141 
00142     return (BLI_natstrcmp(entry1->relname,entry2->relname));
00143 }

00146 double BLI_dir_free_space(const char *dir)
00147 {
00148 #ifdef WIN32
00149     DWORD sectorspc, bytesps, freec, clusters;
00150     char tmp[4];
00151     
00152     tmp[0]='\\'; tmp[1]=0; /* Just a failsafe */
00153     if (dir[0]=='/' || dir[0]=='\\') {
00154         tmp[0]='\\';
00155         tmp[1]=0;
00156     }
00157     else if (dir[1]==':') {
00158         tmp[0]=dir[0];
00159         tmp[1]=':';
00160         tmp[2]='\\';
00161         tmp[3]=0;
00162     }
00163 
00164     GetDiskFreeSpace(tmp,&sectorspc, &bytesps, &freec, &clusters);
00165 
00166     return (double) (freec*bytesps*sectorspc);
00167 #else
00168 
00169 #if defined (__sun__) || defined (__sun) || defined (__NetBSD__)
00170     struct statvfs disk;
00171 #else
00172     struct statfs disk;
00173 #endif
00174     char name[FILE_MAXDIR],*slash;
00175     int len = strlen(dir);
00176     
00177     if (len >= FILE_MAXDIR) /* path too long */
00178         return -1;
00179     
00180     strcpy(name,dir);
00181 
00182     if (len) {
00183         slash = strrchr(name,'/');
00184         if (slash) slash[1] = 0;
00185     }
00186     else strcpy(name,"/");
00187 
00188 #if defined (__FreeBSD__) || defined (linux) || defined (__OpenBSD__) || defined (__APPLE__) || defined(__GNU__) || defined(__GLIBC__)
00189     if (statfs(name, &disk)) return(-1);
00190 #endif
00191 
00192 #if defined (__sun__) || defined (__sun) || defined (__NetBSD__)
00193     if (statvfs(name, &disk)) return(-1);   
00194 #elif !defined(__FreeBSD__) && !defined(linux) && (defined(__sparc) || defined(__sparc__))
00195     /* WARNING - This may not be supported by geeneric unix os's - Campbell */
00196     if (statfs(name, &disk, sizeof(struct statfs), 0)) return(-1);
00197 #endif
00198 
00199     return ( ((double) disk.f_bsize) * ((double) disk.f_bfree));
00200 #endif
00201 }

00203 static void bli_builddir(const char *dirname, const char *relname)
00204 {
00205     struct dirent *fname;
00206     struct dirlink *dlink;
00207     int rellen, newnum = 0;
00208     char buf[256];
00209     DIR *dir;
00210 
00211     BLI_strncpy(buf, relname, sizeof(buf));
00212     rellen=strlen(relname);
00213 
00214     if (rellen) {
00215         buf[rellen]='/';
00216         rellen++;
00217     }
00218 #ifndef WIN32
00219     if (chdir(dirname) == -1) {
00220         perror(dirname);
00221         return;
00222     }
00223 #else
00224     UTF16_ENCODE(dirname);
00225     if (!SetCurrentDirectoryW(dirname_16)) {
00226         perror(dirname);
00227         free(dirname_16);
00228         return;
00229     }
00230     UTF16_UN_ENCODE(dirname);
00231 
00232 #endif
00233     if ((dir = (DIR *)opendir("."))) {
00234         while ((fname = (struct dirent*) readdir(dir)) != NULL) {
00235             dlink = (struct dirlink *)malloc(sizeof(struct dirlink));
00236             if (dlink) {
00237                 BLI_strncpy(buf + rellen ,fname->d_name, sizeof(buf) - rellen);
00238                 dlink->name = BLI_strdup(buf);
00239                 BLI_addhead(dirbase,dlink);
00240                 newnum++;
00241             }
00242         }
00243         
00244         if (newnum) {
00245 
00246             if (files) {
00247                 void *tmp = realloc(files, (totnum+newnum) * sizeof(struct direntry));
00248                 if (tmp) {
00249                     files = (struct direntry *)tmp;
00250                 }
00251                 else { /* realloc fail */
00252                     free(files);
00253                     files = NULL;
00254                 }
00255             }
00256             
00257             if (files==NULL)
00258                 files=(struct direntry *)malloc(newnum * sizeof(struct direntry));
00259 
00260             if (files) {
00261                 dlink = (struct dirlink *) dirbase->first;
00262                 while (dlink) {
00263                     memset(&files[actnum], 0 , sizeof(struct direntry));
00264                     files[actnum].relname = dlink->name;
00265                     files[actnum].path = BLI_strdupcat(dirname, dlink->name);
00266 // use 64 bit file size, only needed for WIN32 and WIN64. 
00267 // Excluding other than current MSVC compiler until able to test
00268 #ifdef WIN32
00269                     {wchar_t * name_16 = alloc_utf16_from_8(dlink->name,0);
00270 #if (defined(WIN32) || defined(WIN64)) && (_MSC_VER>=1500)
00271                     _wstat64(name_16,&files[actnum].s);
00272 #elif defined(__MINGW32__)
00273                     _stati64(dlink->name,&files[actnum].s);
00274 #endif
00275                     free(name_16);};
00276 
00277 #else
00278                     stat(dlink->name,&files[actnum].s);
00279 #endif
00280                     files[actnum].type=files[actnum].s.st_mode;
00281                     files[actnum].flags = 0;
00282                     totnum++;
00283                     actnum++;
00284                     dlink = dlink->next;
00285                 }
00286             }
00287             else {
00288                 printf("Couldn't get memory for dir\n");
00289                 exit(1);
00290             }
00291 
00292             BLI_freelist(dirbase);
00293             if (files) qsort(files, actnum, sizeof(struct direntry), (int (*)(const void *,const void*))bli_compare);
00294         }
00295         else {
00296             printf("%s empty directory\n",dirname);
00297         }
00298 
00299         closedir(dir);
00300     }
00301     else {
00302         printf("%s non-existant directory\n",dirname);
00303     }
00304 }
00305 
00306 static void bli_adddirstrings(void)
00307 {
00308     char datum[100];
00309     char buf[512];
00310     char size[250];
00311     static const char * types[8] = {"---", "--x", "-w-", "-wx", "r--", "r-x", "rw-", "rwx"};
00312     int num, mode;
00313 #ifdef WIN32
00314     __int64 st_size;
00315 #else
00316     off_t st_size;
00317 #endif
00318     
00319     struct direntry * file;
00320     struct tm *tm;
00321     time_t zero= 0;
00322     
00323     for (num=0, file= files; num<actnum; num++, file++) {
00324 #ifdef WIN32
00325         mode = 0;
00326         BLI_strncpy(file->mode1, types[0], sizeof(file->mode1));
00327         BLI_strncpy(file->mode2, types[0], sizeof(file->mode2));
00328         BLI_strncpy(file->mode3, types[0], sizeof(file->mode3));
00329 #else
00330         mode = file->s.st_mode;
00331 
00332         BLI_strncpy(file->mode1, types[(mode & 0700) >> 6], sizeof(file->mode1));
00333         BLI_strncpy(file->mode2, types[(mode & 0070) >> 3], sizeof(file->mode2));
00334         BLI_strncpy(file->mode3, types[(mode & 0007)], sizeof(file->mode3));
00335         
00336         if (((mode & S_ISGID) == S_ISGID) && (file->mode2[2]=='-'))file->mode2[2]='l';
00337 
00338         if (mode & (S_ISUID | S_ISGID)) {
00339             if (file->mode1[2]=='x') file->mode1[2]='s';
00340             else file->mode1[2]='S';
00341 
00342             if (file->mode2[2]=='x')file->mode2[2]='s';
00343         }
00344 
00345         if (mode & S_ISVTX) {
00346             if (file->mode3[2] == 'x') file->mode3[2] = 't';
00347             else file->mode3[2] = 'T';
00348         }
00349 #endif
00350 
00351 #ifdef WIN32
00352         strcpy(file->owner,"user");
00353 #else
00354         {
00355             struct passwd *pwuser;
00356             pwuser = getpwuid(file->s.st_uid);
00357             if ( pwuser ) {
00358                 BLI_strncpy(file->owner, pwuser->pw_name, sizeof(file->owner));
00359             }
00360             else {
00361                 BLI_snprintf(file->owner, sizeof(file->owner), "%d", file->s.st_uid);
00362             }
00363         }
00364 #endif
00365 
00366         tm= localtime(&file->s.st_mtime);
00367         // prevent impossible dates in windows
00368         if (tm==NULL) tm= localtime(&zero);
00369         strftime(file->time, sizeof(file->time), "%H:%M", tm);
00370         strftime(file->date, sizeof(file->date), "%d-%b-%y", tm);
00371 
00372         /*
00373          * Seems st_size is signed 32-bit value in *nix and Windows.  This
00374          * will buy us some time until files get bigger than 4GB or until
00375          * everyone starts using __USE_FILE_OFFSET64 or equivalent.
00376          */
00377         st_size= file->s.st_size;
00378 
00379         if (st_size > 1024*1024*1024) {
00380             BLI_snprintf(file->size, sizeof(file->size), "%.2f GB", ((double)st_size)/(1024*1024*1024));
00381         }
00382         else if (st_size > 1024*1024) {
00383             BLI_snprintf(file->size, sizeof(file->size), "%.1f MB", ((double)st_size)/(1024*1024));
00384         }
00385         else if (st_size > 1024) {
00386             BLI_snprintf(file->size, sizeof(file->size), "%d KB", (int)(st_size/1024));
00387         }
00388         else {
00389             BLI_snprintf(file->size, sizeof(file->size), "%d B", (int)st_size);
00390         }
00391 
00392         strftime(datum, 32, "%d-%b-%y %H:%M", tm); /* XXX, is this used? - campbell */
00393 
00394         if (st_size < 1000) {
00395             BLI_snprintf(size, sizeof(size), "%10d",
00396                          (int) st_size);
00397         }
00398         else if (st_size < 1000 * 1000) {
00399             BLI_snprintf(size, sizeof(size), "%6d %03d",
00400                          (int) (st_size / 1000), (int) (st_size % 1000));
00401         }
00402         else if (st_size < 100 * 1000 * 1000) {
00403             BLI_snprintf(size, sizeof(size), "%2d %03d %03d",
00404                          (int) (st_size / (1000 * 1000)), (int) ((st_size / 1000) % 1000), (int) ( st_size % 1000));
00405         }
00406         else {
00407             /* XXX, whats going on here?. 2x calls - campbell */
00408             BLI_snprintf(size, sizeof(size), "> %4.1f M", (double) (st_size / (1024.0 * 1024.0)));
00409             BLI_snprintf(size, sizeof(size), "%10d", (int) st_size);
00410         }
00411 
00412         BLI_snprintf(buf, sizeof(buf), "%s %s %s %7s %s %s %10s %s",
00413                      file->mode1, file->mode2, file->mode3, file->owner,
00414                      file->date, file->time, size, file->relname);
00415 
00416         file->string = BLI_strdup(buf);
00417     }
00418 }

00420 unsigned int BLI_dir_contents(const char *dirname,  struct direntry **filelist)
00421 {
00422     // reset global variables
00423     // memory stored in files is free()'d in
00424     // filesel.c:freefilelist()
00425 
00426     actnum = totnum = 0;
00427     files = NULL;
00428 
00429     bli_builddir(dirname,"");
00430     bli_adddirstrings();
00431 
00432     if (files) {
00433         *(filelist) = files;
00434     }
00435     else {
00436         // keep blender happy. Blender stores this in a variable
00437         // where 0 has special meaning.....
00438         *(filelist) = files = malloc(sizeof(struct direntry));
00439     }
00440 
00441     return(actnum);
00442 }

00445 size_t BLI_file_descriptor_size(int file)
00446 {
00447     struct stat buf;
00448 
00449     if (file <= 0) return (-1);
00450     fstat(file, &buf);//CHANGE
00451     return (buf.st_size);
00452 }

00454 size_t BLI_file_size(const char *path)
00455 {
00456     int size, file = BLI_open(path, O_BINARY|O_RDONLY, 0);
00457     
00458     if (file == -1)
00459         return -1;
00460     
00461     size = BLI_file_descriptor_size(file);
00462     close(file);
00463     return size;
00464 }

00466 
00467 int BLI_exists(const char *name)
00468 {
00469 #if defined(WIN32) 
00470 #ifndef __MINGW32__
00471     struct _stat64i32 st;
00472 #else
00473     struct _stati64 st;
00474 #endif
00475     /* in Windows stat doesn't recognize dir ending on a slash
00476      * To not break code where the ending slash is expected we
00477      * don't mess with the argument name directly here - elubie */
00478     wchar_t * tmp_16 = alloc_utf16_from_8(name, 0);
00479     int len, res;
00480     len = wcslen(tmp_16);
00481     if (len > 3 && ( tmp_16[len-1]==L'\\' || tmp_16[len-1]==L'/') ) tmp_16[len-1] = '\0';
00482 #ifndef __MINGW32__
00483     res = _wstat(tmp_16, &st);
00484 #else
00485     res = _wstati64(tmp_16, &st);
00486 #endif
00487     free(tmp_16);
00488     if (res == -1) return(0);
00489 #else
00490     struct stat st;
00491     if (stat(name,&st)) return(0);  
00492 #endif
00493     return(st.st_mode);
00494 }

00497 int BLI_is_dir(const char *file)
00498 {
00499     return S_ISDIR(BLI_exists(file));
00500 }

00502 int BLI_is_file(const char *path)
00503 {
00504     int mode= BLI_exists(path);
00505     return (mode && !S_ISDIR(mode));
00506 }

00508 LinkNode *BLI_file_read_as_lines(const char *name)
00509 {
00510     FILE *fp= BLI_fopen(name, "r");
00511     LinkNode *lines= NULL;
00512     char *buf;
00513     size_t size;
00514 
00515     if (!fp) return NULL;
00516         
00517     fseek(fp, 0, SEEK_END);
00518     size= (size_t)ftell(fp);
00519     fseek(fp, 0, SEEK_SET);
00520 
00521     buf= MEM_mallocN(size, "file_as_lines");
00522     if (buf) {
00523         size_t i, last= 0;
00524         
00525             /* 
00526              * size = because on win32 reading
00527              * all the bytes in the file will return
00528              * less bytes because of crnl changes.
00529              */
00530         size= fread(buf, 1, size, fp);
00531         for (i=0; i<=size; i++) {
00532             if (i==size || buf[i]=='\n') {
00533                 char *line= BLI_strdupn(&buf[last], i-last);
00534 
00535                 BLI_linklist_prepend(&lines, line);
00536                 last= i+1;
00537             }
00538         }
00539         
00540         MEM_freeN(buf);
00541     }
00542     
00543     fclose(fp);
00544     
00545     BLI_linklist_reverse(&lines);
00546     return lines;
00547 }
00548 
00549 void BLI_file_free_lines(LinkNode *lines)
00550 {
00551     BLI_linklist_free(lines, (void(*)(void*)) MEM_freeN);
00552 }

00555 int BLI_file_older(const char *file1, const char *file2)
00556 {
00557 #ifdef WIN32
00558     struct _stat st1, st2;
00559 
00560     UTF16_ENCODE(file1);
00561     UTF16_ENCODE(file2);
00562     
00563     if (_wstat(file1_16, &st1)) return 0;
00564     if (_wstat(file2_16, &st2)) return 0;
00565 
00566     UTF16_UN_ENCODE(file2);
00567     UTF16_UN_ENCODE(file1);
00568 #else
00569     struct stat st1, st2;
00570 
00571     if (stat(file1, &st1)) return 0;
00572     if (stat(file2, &st2)) return 0;
00573 #endif
00574     return (st1.st_mtime < st2.st_mtime);
00575 }
